comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: What a remarkable pic. NSW Governor Sir Philip Game (here wearing feather duster affair on head) dismissed NSW Premier Jack Lang from office some 7 weeks after this pic was taken, on 13 May 1932. The seating arrangements say it all. Game on the right, Lang on the left and a significant space between!

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: Who is that in the front of the car with the same hat ?      It would appear to be someone called Lord Gifford,   there is another photo of the Bridge opening  and there are two guys with similar hats in that.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: That looks like him! - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=9954 ; Now who is the driver?

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: Your photo caption is more informative.   Lord Gifford is Sir Philip's aide-de-camp.   The very similar photo at wikipedia doesn't say that.  Curious how a common knight has a Lord as aide-de-camp, not sure how that works.
